extends java.lang.Object
    Copyright (C), 2015-2020,FEITIAN Technologies Co., Ltd. All rights reserved. Control printer related interface

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Printer getInstance(android.content.Context context)

      • open

        public int open()
        This method is used to initialize the printer.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • close

        public int close()
        This method is used to close the printer. When the printing task is complete, we should close the printer module.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • startCaching

        public int startCaching()
        This method is used to cache the print data. First of all, this method restores the printer's default settings and clears the cached data. After that, it starts a new caching process, and subsequent calls to print Str, print Bmp, and print QR code will all be done on the canvas in the cache, and finally, the print method prints the contents of the canvas in the cache onto the paper.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setGray

        public int setGray(int level)
        This method is used to set the printing grayscale. Once the function is set up successfully, it is permanently valid unless the function is called again to modify it.
        Parameters:
        level - The printing grayscale value, the valid range is 0~6. The larger the gray value, the darker the printing effect, but the slower the printing speed.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setFont

        public int setFont(android.os.Bundle parameter)
        This method is used to set the print font, including font name, bold, underline, italic, and other effects. This setting is done in memory and will affect subsequent print Str if it is successfully set. The default font will be restored when the app is restarted.
        Parameters:
        parameter - Font parameter data structure. set font(Three ways, with the following priorities): "font"(string) - Font name.Such as "DEFAULT" "systemFont"(string) - Font name.Such as "DroidSans-Bold.ttf" "path"(string) - Font name,absolute path.Such as "/sdcard/ft/fonts/DroidSans-Bold.ttf"

        "format"(int) - Font format, bold, italic, etc. "style"(int) - Font style, can be the following values: 0x00: default style (i.e. this parameter does not work); 0x01: with underscore style; 0x02: with delete line style. "size"(int) - Font size.

        Returns:
        0:Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setSpace

        public int setSpace(int x,
                    int y)
        This method is used to set the line spacing and column spacing. This setting affects how the print Str function prints. This setting is done in memory and will affect subsequent print Str functions. After restarting the App, it will return to the default value of 0.
        Parameters:
        x - Column spacing (in dots), 0 by default, and 32 at maximum.
        y - The line spacing (in dots), 0 by default, 32 at maximum.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setMargin

        public int setMargin(int left,
                     int right)
        This method is used to set the width of the left margin and the right margin of the print paper. This setting is done in memory and affects all subsequent printing methods. After restarting the App, it will return to the default value of 0.
        Parameters:
        left - The width of the left margin, in dots. Range: 0~64.
        right - The width of the right margin, in dots. Range: 0~64.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setAlignStyle

        public int setAlignStyle(int style)
        This method is used to set the alignment style. Note: If we call this method with a print style of PRINT_STYLE_LEFT, PRINT_STYLE_RIGHT, and PRINT_STYLE_CENTER, the x-coordinate set by the printMoveTo method will be ignored. This method affects all subsequent printing operations, including printing text, bitmaps, and QR codes.
        Parameters:
        style - Print style;PRINT_STYLE_LEFT, PRINT_STYLE_RIGHT, and PRINT_STYLE_CENTER.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printStr

        public int printStr(java.lang.String text)
        This method is used to output a string to the canvas in the printing cache.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be printed, in UTF-8 format. 1.If the printing string is out of the right boundary, it will wrap and continue to print. 2.It support for '\n' controls characters in strings to be printed and wrap immediately if '\n' character is encountered. 3.This method has a maximum processing buffer of 2047 bytes at a time.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printBmp

        public int printBmp(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This method is used to output a bitmap to the canvas in the printing cache.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap data to be printed.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printQRCode

        public int printQRCode(byte[] qrData,
                       int mode)
        This method is used to output a QR code or Bar code to the canvas in the printing cache. This method can automatically generate the appropriate QR code or bar code according to the input data.
        Parameters:
        qrData - The data to generate the QR code or Bar code.
        mode - The type. 0: QR code; 1: bar code.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • print

        public void print(OnPrinterCallback onPrinterCallback)
        This method will print the cached data to the print paper.
        Parameters:
        onPrinterCallback - Print data callback interface.

      • printWithFeed

        public void printWithFeed(int feedPixel,
                          OnPrinterCallback onPrinterCallback)
        This method will print the cached data to the print paper.
        Parameters:
        feedPixel - Paper walking pixels
        onPrinterCallback - Print data callback interface.

      • feed

        public int feed(int pixel)
        This method is used to feed paper.
        Parameters:
        pixel - The number of printing dots on the Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus(PrintStatus status)
        This method is used to get the printer status, such as if it is out of paper.
        Parameters:
        status - Gets the state of the printer including whether there is paper, temperature, gray value.
        Returns:
        0: Success; ERR_CONDITIONS_NOT_ALLOWED:The printer is not initialized.The startCaching function needs to be called. Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • getUsedPaperLenManage

        public int getUsedPaperLenManage()
        Gets the length of paper printed by the printer.
        Returns:
        length of paper printed by the printer.

      • setBckColor

        public int setBckColor(boolean color)
        Set the background color
        Parameters:
        color - PRINTER_BCK_COLOR_WRITE, PRINTER_BCK_COLOR_BLOCK.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printStrVertical

        public int printStrVertical(java.lang.String text)
        Print the vertical direction of the string
        Parameters:
        text - The string to be printed
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • moveTo

        public int moveTo(int x,
                  int y)
        Set the current cursor position.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate relative position, unit: pixel point, effective range (-384-384) Beyond the effective range The cursor position moves to the end beyond the effective range.
        y - The relative position of the Y coordinate can only be moved down. Unit: Pixel point, effective range (0-1600), longest 10cm.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printQRCodeEx

        public int printQRCodeEx(byte[] qrData,
                         android.os.Bundle parameter)
        This method is used to output a QR code or Bar code to the canvas in the printing cache. This method can automatically generate the appropriate QR code or bar code according to the input data.
        Parameters:
        qrData - The data to generate the QR code or Bar code.
        parameter - Bar code configuration information collection. "mode"(int) The type. 0: QR code; 1: bar code. 2:PDF417. "height"(int) - Generate bar code height. "width"(int) - When generating a one-dimensional code, this parameter is the width of the generated bar code.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • detectBlackMark

        public int detectBlackMark(int maxDots,
                           int skipDots)
        Black block is detected and the paper is moved to the specified location.
        Parameters:
        maxDots - The maximum length of this paper, the black block can not be detected automatically stop.
        skipDots - The distance jumped after the black block was detected.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setFontStatus

        public int setFontStatus(int flag)
        Sets the print font state.
        Parameters:
        flag - 0- normal font, 1- double line height, 2- double line width.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • setDoubleStatus

        public int setDoubleStatus(boolean flag)
        Sets the two-dot printing state.
        Parameters:
        flag - True - double dot printing, false- normal printing.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

      • printThreeStrInOneLine

        public int printThreeStrInOneLine(int firstWidth,
                                  int secondWidth,
                                  java.lang.String firstStr,
                                  java.lang.String secondStr,
                                  java.lang.String thirdStr)
        Print three strings on the same line.
        Parameters:
        firstWidth - The first string width.
        secondWidth - Second string width.
        firstStr - The first string content.
        secondStr - The second string content.
        thirdStr - The third string content.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

        Parameters:
        printerColumnInfo - This is to set the number of columns property
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode

        pbText - Display text content

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code.Refer toErrCode
